snippet: First, they sent my wife away. Now the Communist Party is trying to kick me out of my house during the 18th Party Congress.
abstract: Op-Ed article by novelist Wang Lixiong recounts his interactions with Chinese authorities, who have ordered both him and his wife, who is Tibetan, out of Beijing in advance of once-in-a-decade coronation of new party leaders, due to her ethnicity and his writings on national minorities.
lead_paragraph: First, they sent my wife away. Now the Communist Party is trying to kick me out of my house during the 18th Party Congress.

headline.seo: In China, Unwelcome at the Party
